abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column examines exceptional performance by Los Angeles Dodgers ace Zack Greinke, whose earned run average of 1.39 is lowest before All-Star break since 1968; observes that despite scoreless streak of 35 and two-thirds innings, Greinke still feels he performed better in 2009, when he says he faced more difficult hitters.
lead_paragraph: Greinke said he thought he pitched better with Kansas City in 2009, even though his earned run average, 1.39, is the lowest before the All-Star break since 1968 and he has not allowed a run in his last 35 2/3 innings.

headline.main: Zack Greinke Says He’s Been Better, but Hitters May Disagree
headline.print_headline: Sorry, Hitters: Greinke Thinks He Can Be Better

snippet: Greinke said he thought he pitched better with Kansas City in 2009, even though his earned run average, 1.39, is the lowest before the All-Star break since 1968 and he has not allowed a run in his last 35 2/3 innings.
